columns.text: In this problem, we will solve for the minimum acceptable revenue that the company can make based on the different costs of operation as well as the prices and quantities of their sold products.

**Total production costs** refer to the summation of all the costs associated with producing the product. In this case, we can simply add in the raw material costs and the labor costs.

$$\begin{aligned}\
\text{v}&=\$33.18+\$24.36\\[15 pt]
&=\$57.54
\end{aligned}$$

Substituting the values, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{TC}&=(\$57.54 \times 145,000) + \$1,750,000\\[15 pt]
&=\$8,343,300+\$1,750,000\\[15 pt]
&=\$10,093,300.00
\end{aligned}$$

The total cost of production is $\$10,093,300.00$

The **marginal cost per pair** refers to the change in production costs associated with adding an additional unit in production. Since we already know how much a unit costs, then this cost is equal to the marginal cost.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Marginal cost}&=\$33.18+\$24.36\\
&=\$57.54
\end{aligned}$$

The **average cost** can be obtained by taking the total costs and dividing it to the total quantity produced.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Average cost}&=\dfrac{\text{TC}}{\text{Q}}\\[15 pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{Total cost}}{\text{Total quantity}}\\
&=\dfrac{\$10,093,300.00}{145,000}\\
&=\$69.61
\end{aligned}$$

The average cost per pair is $\$69.61$

Substituting the values, we will get:
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Average cost}&=\dfrac{\$10,093,300.00}{145,000}\\[15 pt]
&=\$69.61
\end{aligned}$$

The average cost per pair is $\$69.61$

The **minimum acceptable revenue** refers to the revenue that must be enough to cover the marginal costs of production. This means that the revenue should be equal to the marginal cost multiplied to the number of additional units. To solve this, we can use the formula:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Minimum acceptable revenue}&=\text{Marginal cost} \times \text{Q}\\

\end{aligned}$$

Substituting the values, we will get the minimum acceptable revenue:
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Minimum acceptable revenue}&=\text{Marginal cost} \times \text{Q}\\[15 pt]
&=\$57.54 \times 5,000\\[15 pt]
&=\$287,700.00
\end{aligned}$$

This means that the revenue earned from this order must not be below $\$287,700.00$ since it needs to cover the costs for producing these additional units.
